L180: The Looping Journal of Sunset Shimmer is the journal 【52†Sunset Shimmer】 kept 
L181: during her time as a 【53†Traveling Looper】. It chronicles her travels across the
L182:  multiverse after her first Awakening, and the Keychains she acquired from those
L183:  universes. She is known to have acquired twenty-four separate Keychains during 
L184: that time[ 1 ], including one named "Heart of Joke", from an unidentified 
L185: universe. After returning to Equestria, she was shown acquiring an unidentified 
L186: twenty-fifth, a string of seven pearls on a golden chain, from her interaction 
L187: with Lyra Heartstrings.

L94: Part of 【65†The Infinite Loops Project】.
L95: 
L96: Twilight Sparkle went to Ponyville, redeemed Nightmare Moon, defeated Discord, 
L97: fought the Changelings, and became an Alicorn Princess. Some time after that, 
L98: she found herself back before any of that had happened. Again, and again, and 
L99: again... Then her friends began to join her on occasion, which helped with the 
L100: variety a bit. Now she, as well as over two dozen of her friends, fellows, and 
L101: in some cases erstwhile antagonists are doing the same thing - as well as other 
L102: worlds, worlds that none of them could have imagined. Friends have been made, 
L103: horizons broadened... and plenty of fun had along the way.
L104: 
L105: 【66†My Little Pony】 was not one of the first-activated settings, nor was it one 
L106: even considered in the initial genesis of the Loops. However, it has become 
L107: particularly important to the revival version of the Infinite Loops as presented
L108:  by Saphroneth and those provoked by him, largely because it is the MLP Loops 
L109: which originally got Spacebattles involved.
L110: 
L111: The MLP Loopers tend to be good friends, partly because this is the series' name
L112:  and a core part of their setting, and partly because it is distinct from the 
L113: original Innortal iteration of the Loops. As such, the theme of the MLP Loops 
L114: could be said to be "don't be unkind" - though this is a goal in-universe and 
L115: not one which is met every time - and that the Pony Loopers have a tendency to 
L116: want to help the admins, rather than seeing them as obstacles. Apart from that, 
L117: the main feature of the MLP Loops is sheer scale owing to their long-standing 
L118: nature and the general popularity of the setting. (That and how they're mostly 
L119: ponies.)
L120: 
L121: Aside from revitalizing the Infinite Loops project, the MLP Loops have also 
L122: provided the strong backbone for the revival and as such have had a very 
L123: considerable impact. Several other Loops settings got their genesis via a 
L124: crossover with the MLP Loops, as did a number of Loopers, and more than one 
L125: Anchor originated in a Loop written originally under the aegis of the MLP Loops.
L126:

L96: Twilight Sparkle went to Ponyville, redeemed Nightmare Moon, defeated Discord, 
L97: fought the Changelings, and became an Alicorn Princess. Some time after that, 
L98: she found herself back before any of that had happened. Again, and again, and 
L99: again... Then her friends began to join her on occasion, which helped with the 
L100: variety a bit. Now she, as well as over two dozen of her friends, fellows, and 
L101: in some cases erstwhile antagonists are doing the same thing - as well as other 
L102: worlds, worlds that none of them could have imagined. Friends have been made, 
L103: horizons broadened... and plenty of fun had along the way.
L104: 
L105: 【66†My Little Pony】 was not one of the first-activated settings, nor was it one 
L106: even considered in the initial genesis of the Loops. However, it has become 
L107: particularly important to the revival version of the Infinite Loops as presented
L108:  by Saphroneth and those provoked by him, largely because it is the MLP Loops 
L109: which originally got Spacebattles involved.
L110: 
L111: The MLP Loopers tend to be good friends, partly because this is the series' name
L112:  and a core part of their setting, and partly because it is distinct from the 
L113: original Innortal iteration of the Loops. As such, the theme of the MLP Loops 
L114: could be said to be "don't be unkind" - though this is a goal in-universe and 
L115: not one which is met every time - and that the Pony Loopers have a tendency to 
L116: want to help the admins, rather than seeing them as obstacles. Apart from that, 
L117: the main feature of the MLP Loops is sheer scale owing to their long-standing 
L118: nature and the general popularity of the setting. (That and how they're mostly 
L119: ponies.)
L120: 
L121: Aside from revitalizing the Infinite Loops project, the MLP Loops have also 
L122: provided the strong backbone for the revival and as such have had a very 
L123: considerable impact. Several other Loops settings got their genesis via a 
L124: crossover with the MLP Loops, as did a number of Loopers, and more than one 
L125: Anchor originated in a Loop written originally under the aegis of the MLP Loops.
L126: 
L127: The MLP Loops can be found 【67†here†www.fimfiction.net】 and 
L128: 【68†here.†www.fanfiction.net】 The thread is so long it's been broken into parts:
L129:  【69†1†forums.spacebattles.com】 【70†2†forums.spacebattles.com】 
L130: 【71†3†forums.spacebattles.com】 【72†4†forums.spacebattles.com】 
L131: 【73†5†forums.spacebattles.com】 【74†6†forums.spacebattles.com】 
L132: 【75†7†forums.spacebattles.com】 【76†8†forums.spacebattles.com】 
L133: 【77†9†forums.spacebattles.com】 【78†10†forums.spacebattles.com】
L134: 
L135: * * *
L136: 
L137: ## The MLP Loops provide examples of:
L138: 
L139:   * 【79†Acid Reflux Nightmare】:
L140:     * Variant in 136.6, where it's not food that causes it - instead, Twilight 
L141: remembers why it's a bad idea to watch 【80†The Godfather】 right before bed.
L142:     * In 143.5, Rainbow Dash thinks she's in one of these (it's really a prank 
L143: by Spike) when she sees a werewolfified reflection of herself in the mirror, and
L144:  promptly swears off eating Manexican food before bed.
L145:   * 【81†Actually Pretty Funny】: In one Loop, Princess Celestia woke up to find 
L146: Nightmare Moon standing over her, and was almost immediately on the receiving 
L147: end of a "Royal Canterlot Belly Zerbert". At the time, she reacted by spending 
L148: the day chasing her sister around the castle yelling death threats; in a later 
L149: Loop, she admits to Twilight that upon reflection, she does find it amusing.
L150:   * 【82†Adaptation Relationship Overhaul】: Retroactively in the case of Trixie 
L151: and Chrysalis. In cartoon canon, they never met until the end of Season 6, when 
L152: Trixie was part of the team that entered Chrysalis' hive to rescue the Mane Six 
L153: and the royal family. In the Loops, they've been dating since before the 
L154: expansions into Season 4 and beyond started.
L155:   * 【83†Alpha Bitch】: Diamond Tiara, pre-characterisation or when she's un-
L156: Awake. Twilight also meets another called Sharp Retort during Turning the 
L157: Tables. After years of experience, Twilight manages to outmanoeuvre Retort 
L158: quickly, and the mare leaves in a huff.
L159:   * 【84†All-Loving Hero】: There is enough love in Fluttershy's heart to feed an 
L160: entire colony of Changelings.
L161:   * 【85†Arranged Marriage】:
L162:     * Were a thing in 177.21. Applejack was with someone she thought might have 
L163: been a pony version of Thorin Oakenshield (but didn't know whether he was Awake 
L164: or not), Fluttershy was with Caramel, Rainbow Dash with her old bully Hoops, 
L165: Octavia with Prince Blueblood, and Twilight was with Flash Sentry.
L166:     * In Loop 202.12, Filthy Rich's marriage to Spoiled Milk was an arranged 
L167: one, but Filthy wound up having a one-night stand with Applejack, whom he 
L168: admitted was the one he really wanted to marry, after being told. She got 
L169: pregnant, and Diamond Tiara - who was subsequently raised by Filthy and Spoiled,
L170:  though with the promise that if she found out about her birth mom and wanted to
L171:  rejoin her, she could - was the result.
L172:   * 【86†The Atoner】:
L173:     * Chrysalis. Her first loop Awake was the "Slavequestria" loop, where she 
L174: and a non-Awake Shining Armor were 【87†Happily Married】 and helped runaway 
L175: slaves as part of 【88†La Résistance】. When the Loop reset, Chrysalis was 
L176: horrified to realize that her actions in the prime timeline had not been 【89†All
L177:  Just a Dream】.
L178:     * Sunset Shimmer is also this, as after she Awoke, she's dedicated herself 
L179: to atoning for her sins, swearing never to become like she was in Baseline 
L180: again.
L181:   * 【90†Attack of the 50-Foot Whatever】: After Twilight figures out how to 
L182: trigger Spike's greed-growth (from "Secret of my Excess") as needed, "Spike-
L183: zilla" becomes one option for how to deal with more extreme situations 
L184: encountered in Equestria. Awake!Spike also learns to control his age/size/power-
L185: level and can go Kaiju when he feels it to be appropriate.
L186:   * 【91†Attention Deficit... Ooh, Shiny!】: One version of Twilight actually has 
L187: ADD. She decides to go along with it.
L188:   * 【92†Awesome Moment of Crowning】:
L189:     * Often defied. Looping Celestia has enough of an aversion to paperwork that
L190:  on one occasion she got the Looping Elements confirmed as regents in two 
L191: minutes flat and fled to the beach.
L192:     * In one Loop, a lot of the minor alicorns deliberately ascend for 
L193: ridiculously minor things like eating a lot of muffins. At first unAwake 
L194: Celestia gives them each a full coronation, but she calls it quits after Ivory 
L195: Scroll apparently ascended by choking on a paper clip. It was all a gambit to 
L196: get Celestia to stop forcing alicorns to have responsibility.
L197:     * In the "daughters loops" (where the Cutie Mark Crusaders are Twilight's 
L198: alicorn daughters), she quickly dumps the responsibility on them so she can have
L199:  fun studying elsewhere. To their credit, they immediately decided to initiate a
L200:  golden age so they could have fun and get some college-level partying done 
L201: while "mom" wasn't around.
L202:     * One snippet mentions Twilight has, on occasion, played havoc with her 
L203: coronation, including in one instance singing a modified version of "Modern

L148: the day chasing her sister around the castle yelling death threats; in a later
